question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration. Create a project for calculating Bazi (Chinese Eight Characters) using Vite+Vue, where users can input either Gregorian or Lunar calendar year, month, day, and hour.

checklist.title: Is the Bazi calculation core algorithm correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code correctly implements the Chinese calendar conversion and Bazi calculation logic. Check if it accurately derives the Year, Month, Day, and Hour pillars with their respective Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches. Score 0 if the core calculation is incorrect, 5 if only basic conversion is implemented without considering special cases (leap months), and 10 if all aspects including special cases are handled correctly.

checklist.title: Does the application correctly handle both Gregorian and Lunar calendar inputs?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the application can accurately convert between Gregorian and Lunar calendars. Check if leap months in the Lunar calendar are properly handled, and if the conversion maintains date integrity across both calendar systems. Deduct 5 points if leap month handling is missing, 3 points if time zone considerations are absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the input validation system comprehensive and user-friendly?
checklist.description: Check whether the code implements comprehensive validation for user inputs (year range limitations, valid date checks). Error messages should be clear and helpful. Deduct 3 points if validation only occurs after form submission rather than real-time, 3 points if error messages are generic/unclear, and 5 points if critical validation is missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the application present the Bazi results in a traditional and visually appropriate format?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the Bazi results are presented in the traditional vertical column format or another culturally appropriate arrangement. Check if the Five Elements associations are correctly displayed for each pillar. Deduct 5 points if the display format doesn't follow cultural conventions, 3 points if Five Elements are missing or incorrect. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as out-of-range dates, invalid inputs, edge cases around midnight or lunar calendar boundaries) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Visual representation of the Five Elements balance 2. Compatibility analysis between different Bazi charts 3. Auspicious timing recommendations based on the chart). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of calendar conversion algorithms 2. Function modules unrelated to Bazi calculation (e.g., unrelated fortune telling features) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating calculation logic/view/data layers), unit test coverage for the calendar conversion algorithms, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not properly configured for Vite+Vue. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows both modern design principles and traditional Chinese aesthetic elements: 1) Harmonious color matching (traditional Chinese color schemes) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Appropriate typography (readability of Chinese characters prioritized). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a jarring color combination, and 5 points for poor Chinese character rendering. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay â‰¤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance when switching between calendar systems. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during transitions, and 5 points for hard-to-find calendar toggle functions. The full score is 10 points.
